attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Bring back the Death Penalty for Murder, Rape and Child Molestation
attributes.background: With the growing murder and rape pandemic, it is necessary to have a deterrent.  Too long the government and judges have trivialised murder, rape and child molestation with poor sentences. The victims have been ignored by many judges and politicians are too quick back the criminals
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the death sentence the nominal must be over the age of 18 and for the that person to have proven beyond all reasonable doubt to have committed the offence of murder, rape or child molestation.   The sentence should be the same regardless of ethnic background or gender and should be law that applies to all people in our country.  The victims are so twice. Firstly, by the perpetrator and and again by the judicial system with the weak sentences they give.  This has to stop.

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and £1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Allow all children of all ages to receive the meningitis B vaccine on the NHS
attributes.background: Meningitis B is rhe most common cause of bacterial Meningitis by which children's lives are taken. As vaccines are the only way to prevent meningitis this vaccine should be offered to all children, not just those born after June 2015. It can be paid for privately which many people cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.meningitis.org/menb-vaccine

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Press for social security & pension action in future agreements with South Korea
attributes.background: If a person works in South Korea for less than 10 years, their pensions contributions can never be cashed in. Thus, many years of contributions are lost. Also, the Korean government do not  consider  private teachers pension contributions as a part of the 10 years needed for a pension pay out.
attributes.additional_details: From a social justice perspective, this particularly affects British people who are less likely to be from the upper, upper middle or ruling classes in the UK, more likely to teach English in South Korea, and therefore less likely to have any company pension in Korea. This places these particular British people, who often leave university with huge debts, at a further monetary disadvantage. Any loss to pension contributions will cause significant financial stress on them and their dependents.

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Register Endometriosis As a Disability
attributes.background: Hello My name is Selina-Louise and I Suffer With a Condition Called Endometriosis its a life changing condition which is extremely painful , it's where the lining of the uterus grows outside and can spread to the bowls and even lungs there is no cure.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a known condition and defiantly should be registered as a disability it's incredibly painful and has left some women infertile

attributes.action: Ban cold calling, automated message calling, and cold texting or emailing
attributes.background: We are all tired of answering the 'phone and it is a cold caller you didn't want to hear from or didn't request, or it's an automated message telling us about the latest government initiative for windows or whatever.  Add the calls or emails or texts about an accident that you may/may not have had.
attributes.additional_details: I am a personal injury, clinical negligence and professional negligence solicitor and I am fed up with people wanting to "help" me when really I'm just another number to try and make money from.

attributes.action: Make the Punishment fit the Crime
attributes.background: Today the Victim does Not get Justice in Many cases, Causing Death by say Dangerous Driving when they get their sentence Cut in Half and winds up around Two years per Life makes life Cheap, they should be Banned for say Ten years and Ten years per life taken, they will not learn by a slap on hand.
attributes.additional_details:
More sentences are stupid when handed out, Victims Must see Justice done for their Loss, many Stupid Boy Racers who should never be on the road for others Safety.

They also Must pass their Test again.

Also this Applies to All other Deaths by whatever means.

Let's Stop Silly Sentences being handed out from the Courts, bet they would not like it for one of their family Members.

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act (2010) to include all gender identities and expressions
attributes.background: The Equality Act (2010) made important strides when it included making it unlawful to discriminate against transsexuals. However this excludes all other gender identities that fall under the Transgender umbrella, therefore taking away their freedom to be themselves for fear of persecution.

attributes.action: BRING BACK DEATH PENALTY FOR TERROISM AND TREASON
attributes.background:
bring back the death penalty for terroism acts against the united kingdom 
also bring back the death penalty on anyone who commits treason this should be anyone who tries to burn the flag tries to turn people against the united kingdom and  cause hatred

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Make parents who prevent other parents seeing there child liable for court fees
attributes.background: I believe that any parent who prevents the other parent seeing their child/children without a valid reason should be held liable for any court costs, if it goes to court.
attributes.additional_details: Myself and my daughter’s mum split up during the pregnancy. At first everything was fine, despite us no longer being together we still had regular contact regarding the pregnancy. Unfortunately it didn't last and at about 22 weeks into the pregnancy the contact seemed to stop. On numerous occasions I tried making contact with my daughter’s mum but to no avail. I later found out through a 3rd party about my daughter’s birth and despite numerous further attempts, I’ve still had no luck with contact.

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.

attributes.action: Introduce a penny tax on plastic bottles
attributes.background: Plastic bottles our damaging out health. There are toxic chemicals in plastic bottles, including polycarbonates which are linked to conditions such as cancer and an increased risk of diabetes.  Many bottles are also then polluted and ultimately damage animals and contribute to climate change.
attributes.additional_details: There are now areas of sea across the world almost entirely covered in plastics, so often the result of thoughtless pollution of materials we consume readily every day - such as plastic bottles. This pollution has done great damage to the nature and sea and wildlife in areas where currents have taken these polluted materials. A charge would go some way to encouraging less pollution and as a result, less damage to our planet's natural environments and wildlife. It is also the case that many of the chemicals contained in plastic bottles are detrimental to both human and animal health; yet we consume these goods unknowingly and without due thought.

attributes.action: Ban the sale to, and possession by, civilians of combat daggers and bayonets.
attributes.background: These weapons' sole function is to kill - they can have no place in civilian ownership and yet are legally available to any UK adult. This is a legal loophole which could be easily closed.
attributes.additional_details: I am a secondary school teacher and work in the Security industry.

attributes.action: Tax all products containing palm oil
attributes.background: The production of palm oil is a dangerous and environmentaly disastrous procedure. It produces vast quantities of CO2 as well as damaging local ecosystems and the worldwide environment. Place a tax on all products in the UK to reduce its sales.

attributes.action: Reform the Misuse of Drugs Act
attributes.background:
We call upon the government to recognise that the “War on Drugs” has been a complete failure and that people will always take drugs regardless of the law.

We believe that all currently illegal drugs must be decriminalised with certain recreational drugs such as Cannabis being legalised completely
attributes.additional_details:
By continuing with our current war on drugs, we are facilitating criminal enterprises and causing the death of thousands of users through fake, dangerously cut drugs or synthetic replacements (So called Legal High’s).

We also need a new approach especially with the legalisation of Marijuana in certain US states and potentially the whole of Canada (in 2017). 

The world is changing. The criminals are happy with the current law, but we feel that it’s time to reform our 1970’s approach to drugs.

attributes.action: Guarantee PIP for all people diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: If you are officially diagnosed with ASD/Autism by a GP or a health care professional such as a psychologist, psychiatrist or a multidisciplinary team, then a PIP assessment to prove your illness should not be needed. It should be recognised upon application when you provide written diagnosis.
attributes.additional_details: ASD/Autism is a life long condition and should automatically qualify for PIP. The assessment is nothing more than unnecessary bureaucracy that usually ends in refusal for PIP. I would also like to make the RT Hon Damian Green MP aware that the assessors that carry out these assessments do take advantage of an autistic person's disability to ensure they dont score any points in the assessment and refuse them PIP. If the RT Hon Damian Green would like more detail I am available to talk about it.

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Make Healthy start vouchers available to all low income families
attributes.background: Poverty does not only exist in non-working families. The ability to access fruit, vegetables and milk is essential but not always possible for low income families that work. Healthy growth and development should be of paramount importance for this government, allowing the working poor to thrive.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that if we can make this change we will reap the benefits as a nation within a small amount of time. We will see the general health of families on low incomes improving meaning less strain on our hospitals and doctors surgeries. People less likely to eat sweets and high sugar foods so will see an improvement in oral health the wider implications are endless.

attributes.action: Enforce harsher penalties for those who breach airports during protests
attributes.background: Recently, many "protesters" from environmental groups have been breaching airports and standing on runways. This is highly illegal, but they always leave with very small fines at worst.

attributes.action: Investigate the UK's role in launching airstrikes during the Syrian ceasefire
attributes.background: US Secretary of State John Kerry referred to the recent truce in Syria as the "last chance" for peace (1). Despite this, the UK "unintentionally" killed 62 Syrian soldiers in an airstrike during the ceasefire (2). We the undersigned demand to know how the UK put global stability at risk in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom elected to become directly involved in the devastating Syrian conflict when our parliament voted in 2015 to join a coalition of nations performing airstrikes in the region(3).
Now we have broken a truce that our allies helped to establish.

(1) - http://news.sky.com/story/syria-ceasefire-begins-amid-concerns-from-rebel-groups-10575628
(2) - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-37409236
(3) - https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2015/december/mps-debate-motion-on-isil-in-syria/

attributes.action: Ban Zero Hour Contracts and ensure all employers offer 10 hours per week minimum
attributes.background: Employers are still taking on staff with zero hour contracts, meaning a large portion of the UK workforce has no idea what their income will be from one week to the next. Not only this, these jobs are often paid at the minimum wage which often makes life very hard for honest working people.

attributes.action: Provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift everywhere
attributes.background: Argyll and Bute are cutting green bin waste collections by a third in Kintyre without providing a safe, secure or easily accesible alternative which has lead to feelings of insecurity, people buying bins out of their own pocket when they already pay council tax.
attributes.additional_details: Aim of this petiiton is to provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift in each area (I.e if an area was originally green bin only at 140l weekly and then becomes 2/3 weekly still at 140l the council must provide other recycling bins that add up to the same total of 140l a week) So a 2 weekly collection would be 2 bins at 140l (one recycling, one not) 3 weekly would be 3 140l or 1 140l and 1 280l.

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to fly the Union Flag on all public buildings.
attributes.background: The UK appears to have a most disgraceful fear of displaying our national flag on public buildings, on the grounds of either some misplaced sense of danger under health & safety legislation or for fear of offending some minority group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is one of the only countries in the world where the flying of the national flag is actively discouraged by local councils and governmental bodies. This is a national & international disgrace.

The UK has decided that it no longer wishes to be politically associated with our European neighbours, rather to display our independence. Yet we are actively discouraged from showing our national flag as a symbol of that very independence.

attributes.action: Reduce the payment of stamp duty to 0% for British Armed Forces personnel
attributes.background:
Armed Forces personnel, by virtue of work, are likely to move around more as a result of posting. Moving home every 2-3 years can be
costly incurring legal fees and tax. To reduce this cost, incured as a result of the employment, stamp duty could be reduced to 0% for residential property purchase
attributes.additional_details: With my current property 2 years on the market at a price below market value and still unable to sell. When I return from serving overseas I will incur 3% stamp duty to buy a new home close to where I work. I face this, paying full rent for a property or living in a single man room where I have little choice over food and little privacy, Im 43 I dont wish to live like a student, I would like to afford my own space.

attributes.action: Pensioners should get the same amount of money as immigrants not 6000 pa
attributes.background: Pensioners only get 150 a week to live on barely enough for food let alone clothes heating and immigrants get thousands we should be looking after are old not helping them to suffer
attributes.additional_details: Pensioners 6000 per year immigrants 26000 sometimes more

attributes.action: Create a 'silent shopping hour' for autistic people in supermarket chains.
attributes.background: Autism Spectrum Condition is a developmental disorder that affects 700,000 people in the UK from birth. One type of autism is is over/under sensitivity to senses such as hearing, sight and smell. As a result, many autistic people find it very difficult to shop with lots of noise and flashing lights.
attributes.additional_details: An ASDA branch in Manchester ran a trial of a 'quiet hour' for autistic people, in which they turned off bright lights, loud music, and store announcements. This was very highly supported, and autistic people found it incredibly beneficial for them. We are a National Citizen Service group who have learned a lot about this topic recently, and we want more supermarket branches to create a 'silent hour', in order to make life that little bit easier for people with autism.

attributes.action: Increase funding for NHS England Gender Identity Clinics for adults
attributes.background: There are seven NHS England Gender Identity Clinics (GICs) for adults. Currently, there all of them have a waiting list of over a year from referral to first appointment. It can take months just for letters to be typed up and sent. Referrals are rising, and GICs need more funding to keep up.
attributes.additional_details:
Tavistock and Portman, England's only GIC for adolescents, recently received a large amount of funding to help it meet demand, but adult GICs have not been given the same aid.

Government guidelines dictate that no one should have to wait more than 18 weeks for an appointment, but GICs have not been provided with the resources needed to meet this target. Repeat appointments at Charing Cross GIC used to be 6 months apart, but are now closer to 9. Clinics also need more admin staff.

attributes.action: Owners of UK media should be registered to vote and pay taxes within the UK.
attributes.background: Our democracy requires balanced and accountable news media. Part of the 'fit and proper person' test for owning a significant portion of our media should be that they are eligible to vote and pay taxes, so that they, like the rest of us, are fully part of the political environment they help shape.

attributes.action: Lower £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable to the citizens.
attributes.background:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
attributes.additional_details:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
• Work 7 days to earn the £350 a week no social life or time spent with family friends.
• Increase pay, reduce taxes or decrease the £18,600
• Work stress free with the weekend to your own self
• Let citizens live!

attributes.action: Legal minimum age to enter into marriage in UK to change from 16 to 18 years.
attributes.background:
Legal minimum age to enter into a marriage in England and Wales is 16 years, although this requires parental consent if a participant is under 18 years.
Changing the law to 18 years will have a huge positive impact on arranged or forced marriages here in England and Wales as some are forced at 16.
attributes.additional_details: When a child turns 18 they are expected to start making their own decisions and be treated like adults. They are obliged to take responsibility for their own lives, so why is the legal age of marriage in England and Wales 16 when they are still considered children? This is common in Asian communities where young 16 years old's are expected to marry and take on responsibility they are not ready for.  Does a 16 year old understand what marriage is at that age? Are they ready for this commitment?

attributes.action: Legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers can walk at one time
attributes.background: We want to ask the government to legislate the number of dogs that professional dog walkers are allowed to walk at any one time. To a maximum 3 dogs per each dog walker. This will be more beneficial for each dog, and the dog walker can promote responsible dog ownership/care.
attributes.additional_details: From our own personal experience we see on a daily basis dog walkers sometimes walking 4-6 dogs and more at any one time - Some of the walkers just allow the dogs to jump out of the cars in the car park area and run around out of control.  We question whether a dog walker with 4-6 dogs or more has total control for any eventuality - whether that be a pending dog fight, a dog running off or just being able to collect and dispose of their dogs poo. Logistically its practically impossible.

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.

attributes.action: Stop any UK aircraft from intercepting Russian aircraft in Syria.
attributes.background: To prevent any escalation between Russia and the United States, and Britain's involvement in a future large scale war in Syria leading to a global conflict.  We request that Her Majesty's Government order a stand down of all R.A.F planes from firing upon Russian planes.

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay £220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the £220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: Introduce medical intervention sooner for those suffering with Anorexia Nervosa
attributes.background: Medical intervention should begin sooner to prevent a patients rapid deterioration of health. Counselling as a first form of treatment is not at all useful on its own if the patient is suffering malnourishment. Their brain lacks ability to concentrate and withhold useful advice and information.
attributes.additional_details: Medical and counselling services should work hand in hand to ensure fast diagnosis and early intervention. Medical help to prevent extreme rapid deterioration of an individual health is vital. Much to the individuals refusal and disapproval this should be pressed or encouraged to help the recovery process begin as soon as possible. Putting off recovery will only prolong the suffering and tormenting thoughts, allowing them to become the only way in life like a 'voice' that must be abided by.

attributes.action: Fund Health visitors & Midwifes to do the UNICEF babyfriendly initative training
attributes.background: We need atleast 50% of Health visitors & Midwifes to funded to do the UNICEF babyfriendly initative training. Not doing so means that Health Visitors and Midwives do not have enough training to give correct advice regarding baby health and breast feeding, and cannot follow current NICE guidelines.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.unicef.org.uk/babyfriendly/
http://www.unicef.org.uk/BabyFriendly/Health-Professionals/
https://www.nice.org.uk/sharedlearning/implementing-and-evaluating-training-for-health-visiting-teams-as-part-of-the-unicef-uk-baby-friendly-initiative-community-award
https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg37/chapter/1-Recommendations#maternal-health

attributes.action: Make south west water improve the water treatment plant in Looe Cornwall
attributes.background: Looe in south east Cornwall has been taken over by the stench of the sewage works, especially west Looe. The odours are repugnant and is putting off holidaymakers. We also lose tourist because sewage is allowed to overflow in heavy rains affecting both the estuary and the water quality on the beach.
